description:
Listed Building Consent application in connection with change of use from Public House (A4) to family dwelling (C3) and associated internal and external works together with underpinning to foundations.  Replacement of steel posts and beams to basement, structural restraints to all suspended floors and partitions.  Reinstatement of light well and new railings and new single storey rear extension [Full Planning application ref: P112533 also submitted]
This application may affect the character and appearance of a conservation area and the setting of a listed building.  Town and Country Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended); Sections 67 and 73.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: Any new windows shall accurately replicate the existing original windows surviving to the terrace in terms of material, profile and detailing.  They shall be painted timber, double-hung sash windows with a slim profile and narrow integral (not applied) glazing bars and a putty finish.  The windows shall be without horns and the double-glazing must be ‘crown glass’ and no greater than 10mm in total thickness.

REASON: In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the heritage asset in accordance with PPS5 and policy CS9A and B of the Islington Core Strategy 2011.
